snippet.title: Amber Heard claims Johnny Depp tried to grab phone as she screamed "call the cops" to her friend
snippet.description:
Amber Heard has been spotted in tears as she breaks down after being granted a temporary restraining order against husband Johnny Depp amid abuse allegations.
The 30-year-old actress - who filed for divorce from the Pirates of the Caribbean actor on Monday citing irreconcilable differences - was pictured leaving the Californian court before clutching her face and in tears as she sat in a car.

Heard went to a Los Angeles court with a bruise on her face and was accompanied by her lawyer Samantha Spector, she showed a judge a number of photos of bruises which she claims Depp inflicted upon her.
Heard is said to have refused to file a police report after accusing Depp of physically assaulting her, and at the time did not allege any brutality.
According to reports, officers arrived at her home on Saturday but saw no injury, and left after she refused to offer any more information.
TMZ reports that the judge has ruled Depp is required to stay 100 yards away from his wife - which is made easier by him being in Europe currently to promote his movie.

The website adds that she has the right to live in their family home, although other requests - including an order to keep Depp away from at least one of their pet dogs - was rejected.
TMZ says that Amber is claiming Depp - who was represented by his lawyer - hit her in the face on Saturday night with an iPhone before police were called.

It is said she refused to give a statement to police, who have given her a number to call if she changes her mind.

In legal documents obtained by TMZ, Heard - who appeared to have bruising around her eye as she left court on Friday - accuses him of drug and alcohol abuse, alleging he turned up to her birthday party last month "inebriated and high
At the time, he had not hit the bottle for 18 months, saying: “I just decided that I’d pretty much got everything I could out of it. I investigated wine and spirits thoroughly, and they certainly investigated me as well, and we found out that we got along beautifully, but maybe too well.

“I don’t have the physical need for alcohol. No, it’s more my medication, my self-medication over the years to calm the circus. Once the circus kicks in, the festivities in the brain, it can be ruthless.”

However, in November 2014, he was cut off while attempting to present an award at the Hollywood Film Awards after he slurred his way through a speech.

In March 2015, the set of Pirates of the Caribbean was put on hold after Depp injured himself on what was described as a “wild weekend bender” and required surgery on his right hand.

The following month, reports claimed his two-month marriage to Amber was already “on the rocks” due to his alleged heavy drinking.

A source reportedly said at the time: “He parties and it’s caused huge fights with Amber. It’s been hard for them.”

In June, Depp’s attorney, Martin Singer, denied reports he was in rehabilitation for alcohol abuse, saying of his previous surgery: “The only rehab he went to was for his hand.”

But the following month there were reports of further tensions between Depp and Amber on the Pirates of the Caribbean set. One report claimed Amber was banned from visiting her husband at work due to their constant rows.
